subject: OVERDUE: Annual Physical Examination Required for Medical Readiness
bodyPreview: Sir, this is a reminder that your annual Periodic Health Assessment (PHA) is now 45 days overdue. As a General Officer, maintaining medical readiness is a critical component of your fitness for duty and sets the example for soldiers throughout your command.

body.content:
Sir,

This is a follow-up reminder that your annual Periodic Health Assessment (PHA) is now 45 days overdue. As a General Officer, maintaining medical readiness is a critical component of your fitness for duty and sets the example for soldiers throughout your command.

⚠️ MEDICAL READINESS ALERT

Your current medical readiness status is: NON-DEPLOYABLE (ADMINISTRATIVE)

Required Action:

You must complete your PHA within the next 15 days to restore your medical readiness status and avoid potential reporting to higher headquarters. AR 40-501 (Standards of Medical Fitness) requires all active duty personnel to maintain current medical readiness.

Your Medical Readiness Status:

ComponentStatusDue Date
Periodic Health Assessment (PHA)OVERDUE20 SEP 2025
Dental ExaminationCURRENT15 APR 2026
Hearing ConservationCURRENT28 MAR 2026
Vision ExaminationDUE SOON30 NOV 2025
ImmunizationsCURRENTVarious dates 2026
HIV TestingCURRENT10 JUL 2026

What the PHA Includes:

  • Health History Review: Update to personal medical history, medications, allergies
  • Physical Examination: Comprehensive physical by military physician
    • Vital signs (blood pressure, pulse, temperature, weight, height)
    • Cardiovascular assessment
    • Respiratory assessment
    • Musculoskeletal evaluation
    • Neurological screening
  • Laboratory Tests:
    • Complete Blood Count (CBC)
    • Comprehensive Metabolic Panel (CMP)
    • Lipid panel (cholesterol screening)
    • Hemoglobin A1C (diabetes screening)
    • Urinalysis
    • Age-appropriate cancer screenings
  • Health Risk Assessment: Electronic questionnaire covering:
    • Lifestyle factors (nutrition, exercise, sleep)
    • Mental health screening (PTSD, depression, anxiety)
    • Substance use assessment (alcohol, tobacco)
    • Occupational health exposures
    • Family medical history update
  • Immunization Review: Ensure all required vaccinations are current
  • Deployment Health Assessment: If applicable based on recent deployments

Scheduling Your Appointment:

Given your operational schedule, I have held several appointment slots that you can select from:

DateTimeDurationLocation
Option 1: Monday, 18 NOV0700-09002 hoursWalter Reed NMMC, Bethesda
Executive Health Suite
Option 2: Wednesday, 20 NOV1500-17002 hoursPentagon Health Clinic
Room 1D579
Option 3: Friday, 22 NOV0800-10002 hoursFort Myer Health Clinic
Executive Services
Option 4: Tuesday, 26 NOV0630-08302 hoursWalter Reed NMMC, Bethesda
Executive Health Suite

Expedited VIP Process:

To minimize impact on your schedule, we offer an expedited process for General Officers:

  1. Pre-Appointment (Optional):
    • Lab work can be completed 1-2 days prior to your physical
    • Health Risk Assessment completed online (15 minutes)
    • Medical records pre-reviewed by physician
  2. Day of Appointment:
    • Dedicated exam room with private waiting area
    • No waiting - appointment starts precisely at scheduled time
    • Single physician continuity (COL Hernandez - your primary care manager)
    • Consolidated visit - all components completed in 2-hour block
  3. Follow-Up:
    • Results briefed to you at end of visit
    • Written results provided within 24 hours
    • Any follow-up appointments coordinated immediately

Preparation for Your Appointment:

  • Fasting Required: Nothing to eat or drink (except water) for 8 hours before appointment
  • Bring Current Medications: Bring bottles or list of all current medications and supplements
  • Medical History Updates: Note any health changes since last year
    • New medical conditions or diagnoses
    • Surgeries or hospitalizations
    • Changes in family medical history
    • New symptoms or concerns
  • Wear Comfortable Clothing: Loose-fitting clothes for easy examination
  • Eyeglasses: If you wear glasses, bring them for vision check

Why This Matters:

Beyond regulatory compliance, the annual PHA serves several important purposes:

  • Early Detection: Identifies health issues before they become serious
    • Cardiovascular disease risk factors
    • Diabetes and pre-diabetes
    • Hypertension
    • Cancer screening
  • Preventive Care: Opportunity to discuss health optimization
    • Nutrition and fitness strategies
    • Stress management
    • Sleep hygiene
    • Mental health support
  • Mission Readiness: Ensures you are physically fit for your demanding responsibilities
    • Travel requirements
    • Long work hours
    • High-stress decision making
    • Potential emergency deployment
  • Leadership by Example: Demonstrates commitment to health and readiness
    • Sets standard for subordinates
    • Shows prioritization of medical readiness
    • Reinforces Army values

Current Health Concerns to Address:

Based on your last PHA (September 2024), the following items should be monitored:

  • Blood Pressure: Was borderline high (138/88) - needs recheck and possible intervention
  • Cholesterol: LDL was slightly elevated (145 mg/dL) - diet/exercise counseling needed
  • Weight: BMI at upper normal range - nutrition consultation available
  • Stress Management: You noted high work stress - behavioral health resources available

Consequences of Continued Non-Compliance:

I must inform you of the potential consequences if this requirement is not met within the next 15 days:

  1. Medical Readiness Status: Will remain NON-DEPLOYABLE
    • Reported in weekly readiness briefings
    • May affect command readiness metrics
  2. Administrative Reporting:
    • Overdue PHA reported to HQDA Surgeon General
    • May be included in senior leader readiness reports
    • Could affect officer evaluation reports (OER)
  3. Regulatory Compliance:
    • Potential violation of AR 40-501
    • May trigger inquiry from higher headquarters
  4. Leadership Perception:
    • Sets poor example for subordinates
    • Undermines command emphasis on readiness

Action Required:

Please reply to this email by 15 NOV 2025 with your preferred appointment date/time from the options provided above. If none of these work, please provide 2-3 alternative dates/times and I will accommodate your schedule.

Contact Information:

Primary Care Manager:COL Patricia Hernandez, MD
Board Certified Internal Medicine
General Officer Primary Care
Phone: (301) 295-XXXX
Email: patricia.hernandez@medcom.army.mil
Appointment Scheduling:Ms. Angela Thompson
Executive Health Services Coordinator
Phone: (301) 295-XXXX
Email: angela.thompson@medcom.army.mil
After Hours Urgent:Walter Reed Emergency Department
Phone: (301) 295-4611
24/7 availability

Additional Services Available:

If you would like to address other health concerns during your visit, please let me know in advance and I can allocate additional time:

  • Sports medicine consultation (running injuries, fitness optimization)
  • Nutritionist consultation (weight management, performance nutrition)
  • Behavioral health consultation (stress management, sleep issues)
  • Physical therapy evaluation (chronic pain, injury prevention)
  • Executive health coaching (wellness strategies for senior leaders)

Confidentiality:

Please be assured that all aspects of your medical care are confidential and protected under HIPAA. Medical readiness status is reported, but specific medical details are not disclosed to your chain of command.

I appreciate your attention to this important matter and look forward to seeing you soon. Your health is critical not only to your personal well-being but also to your ability to lead and fulfill your mission.

If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to contact me directly.

Respectfully,

COL Patricia Hernandez, MD
Chief, General Officer Medicine
Walter Reed National Military Medical Center
Board Certified Internal Medicine
Office: (301) 295-XXXX
Mobile: (301) 555-XXXX
patricia.hernandez@medcom.army.mil

Reference: AR 40-501 (Standards of Medical Fitness)
Patient ID: [REDACTED]
Last PHA: 20 SEP 2024
Days Overdue: 45 days
Classification: UNCLASSIFIED//FOUO
